abstracts.cdata!:
This is the environmental assessment for
            the Niger Water Supply and Sanitation Sector Study Project,
            which identifies potential environmental impacts resulting
            from project implementation, and proposes measures to
            mitigate negative effects. It is anticipated that
            groundwater stability, surface waters, and related
            ecosystems will be endangered due to sewerage works;
            wastewater discharges will affect both urban, and rural
            environments; income revenues will be affected by the loss
            of productive agricultural land; and, public health may be
            temporarily affected as a result of unsafe sanitary
            conditions. Mitigation measures include: 1) regular
            systematic monitoring of groundwater, and aquifers, to
            ensure long-term safety of the water resources, to be
            controlled by the Ministry of Water Resources; 2) water
            treatment facilities will be designed to control sludge
            disposal, under the aegis of the Ministry of Hydraulics,
            and, appropriate technical specifications within the bidding
            documents will enforce sludge treatment processes, for the
            safe production of drinking water; 3) compensation for land,
            or income losses, will be reimbursed by the Societe du
            Patrimonie des Eaux du Niger; 4) public awareness, and
            sanitary hygiene education will be promoted to minimize
            health hazards. Precautionary clauses in the bidding
            documents will ensure air, and noise abatement, to ease
            temporary construction nuisances; and; 5) vegetative
            propagation, and reforestation will be implemented under the
            supervision of the Ministry of Water Resources.
